chapter.title: Preferences
chapter.para: This dialog is accessible by selecting in the menu (the OmegaT menu on macOS).
Use the search field at the top of the preferences list to look for specific items.
Preferences set in this dialog are saved to the default and apply to all translation projects unless you have specified a different configuration folder.

note.para: It is possible to have OmegaT use a different configuration folder to define project-specific configurations. See for details. If you specify such a configuration folder, all modifications made in this dialog will be stored there.

section.title: Dictionary
section.para: Preferences here define how the contents of the folder are displayed in the pane.

OmegaT will use the associated tokenizer to find matches.

Select a theme for the OmegaT user interface.
Additional themes can be added as plugins. The themes also provide predefined set of default colors.
Not all natively provided Java themes are compatible with OmegaT operation.
Restores the OmegaT window panes to their default arrangement.

Use this feature when you are unable to restore the desired arrangement after undocking, moving, or hiding one or more panes. You can use it when panes do not appear as expected after an OmegaT upgrade.

section.title: Font
section.para: Select the font and font size used to display the text in the main window panes.

note.para: OmegaT uses the same font for both the source and target languages. If you work in a language pair that uses different writing systems, make sure you choose a font that can display both languages correctly. Characters that are not supported will appear as squares.

varlistentry.term: Apply this font to tabular data (project files, statistics, etc.)

listitem.para: Tabular data is by default displayed in a monospaced font that keeps columns properly aligned. Using a proportional font will break that layout.

varlistentry.term: Apply a different font size to the dictionary pane

listitem.para: By default, the dictionary pane uses the same font size as the main window panes.

section.title: Colors
section.para: You can assign different colors for to the various parts of the user interface.
Scripts can be used to set predefined themes. OmegaT is bundled with a script called that provides a default dark theme. See for details.

section.title: Global File Filters
section.para: This dialog lists the file filters available to projects that do not use local file filters.
The contents of this preference is identical to the contents of the dialog. See for details.

note.para: If local file filters are used, modifying global file filters will have no effect of the project.

section.title: Global Segmentation Rules
section.para: See for a general explanation of segmentation (global or local, paragraph or sentence, etc.)

warning.para: This dialog only accesses the global segmentation rules. If you have set local rules in , modifications here will not be taken into account.

section.title: Language sets
section.para: Only the rules associated to language patterns that correspond to the source language of your project are applied. See in .

example.title: Rules for Japanese
example.para: For a translation from Japanese, only the rule set associated to the JA.* pattern and the generic rule sets associated to the .* will be taken into account.

section.para: When you click on a language pattern in the top half of the dialog, a list of associated rules will be displayed in the bottom half of the dialog.
All segmentation rule sets for a matching language pattern are active and are applied in order. Rules for specific language regions should be higher than default ones.

example.title: Cascading priorities
example.para: The rules for FR-CA should be set higher than those for FR.*, which should themselves be higher than the generic .* set.
Thus, when translating from Canadian French the rules for Canadian French—if any—will apply first, followed by the rules for French and lastly, by the generic rules.

section.para:
To create a new rule set:
Click Add. An empty line will appear at the bottom of the table.
Change the name of the rule set and the language pattern to the desired label and corresponding pattern. The language pattern is a regular expression.
Use the Move Up button to set the rule set priority.

section.title: Set contents

warning.para: Exception rules should be listed above break rules.
When OmegaT reads files, it puts a non-breaking marker at every exception location. Places that do not have such markers and that match break rules will be break locations.

listitem.para: To define an exception rule, leave the Break/Exception check box unchecked.

Specify text combinations that are exceptions to a break rule. For example, Mrs. Dalloway should not be split in two segments even though a break rule for period followed by a space generally defines a sentence.
To define a break rule, check the Break/Exception box.
Separates the source text into segments. For example, period followed by a space generally defines a sentence end in English.
The Before pattern identifies the parts that are before the break or exception point.
The After patterns identifies the parts that are after the break or exception point.

The Before and After patterns are regular expressions. See
for details.

section.para: The existing rules always provide a good starting point. See also .

section.title: Auto-Completion
section.para: Click on Glossary to configure the auto-completer glossary view.
Click on Autotext to configure the Autotext options, and to add or remove entries.
Click on Character Table to set the Character table auto-completer options.
Click on Enable history completion or Enable history prediction to set history based completions.

note.para: Absolutely none of your data (history, etc.) is ever sent to an external server by OmegaT for processing. All prediction/completion results are computed locally.

section.para: If the Show Relevant Suggestions Automatically option is checked, typing the first letter of a translated glossary entry, or < for a tag, automatically launches the auto-completer.

section.title: Spellchecker
section.para: OmegaT has a built-in spellchecker but requires you to install spellchecking dictionaries based on your target languages.

warning.para: OmegaT will use the language dictionary that has the same name as the target language code set in . An FR-FR dictionary will not spellcheck FR target segments. If necessary, modify the name of the dictionary or change your project’s language settings.

listitem.para: Enable after installing a spellchecking dictionary. OmegaT will underline spelling mistakes with red wavy-lines.
Use the to correct the mistake, to Ignore All or to Add to Dictionary. See spellchecker files for details.

If none are displayed it either means that you have not yet installed a spelling dictionary, or that your project uses a specific configuration folder that does not contain yet a spelling dictionary.
The default URL where OmegaT will look for dictionaries to install.
You can also download dictionaries from other locations, or copy dictionaries installed locally.

Using a different language checker on your local machine than the one supplied with OmegaT allows you to customize the verification rules.
Select the rules depending on whether they are relevant to the type of text you are translating.

section.title: Global External Searches
section.para: External searches are either web searches or local commands that take the string selected in the Editor as a parameter. The web searches are opened in the default browser and the commands are equivalent to items launched on the command line.

warning.para: For security reasons, are disabled by default.

listitem.para: Local external search commands are saved in . Only activate this option if you trust the source of that file.
This option enables you to change the order of the commands in the Editor pane . Values around 100 display commands at the top, and values around 900 display them at the bottom.

warning.para: Restart OmegaT to apply this change.

listitem.para: Each set represents a group of web searches or local commands that are launched simultaneously.
A set must be given a name. The name will be displayed at the bottom of the menu.
If you check Show in Editor context menu, the set name will also be displayed in the if a string is selected.
URL searches as well as commands must contain the string {target} to be accepted. The {target} placeholder will be replaced by the string that was selected in the Editor.
URLs are opened with the default web browser, one per tab.

example.para: This opens a search for the {target} term on DuckDuckGo with a number of search parameters.

listitem.para: Commands are opened on the command line. The Delimiterdefines the delimiter between command parameters. The default delimiter is |.

varlistentry.term: Attempt to convert fuzzy match numbers

listitem.para: When a fuzzy match is inserted, OmegaT tries to adapt the numbers in the fuzzy match to the numbers in the source.

note.para: Only integers and simple floats (e.g., 5.4) are considered.

listitem.para: A translation that is identical to the source text is not recognized as a translation by default. OmegaT will erase it and will count the segment as not translated.
Use this option to force OmegaT to register such entries and count them as translated.

Use regular expressions to define custom tags. To define a list of tags, group each tag between parentheses and separate the groups with | (equivalent to "OR" in regular expressions).
For example, use \d+ to treat all numbers as tags, enabling you to check that numbers have not been accidentally changed in the translation.
Similarly, use </?[^>]+> to make sure that HTML (or similar) tags entered into the source text are preserved without modification in the translation.
Use parentheses and | to have OmegaT consider the two tags: (\d+)|(</?[^>]+>).
See for details.

section.title: Proxy Login
section.para: If you use an authenticated proxy server to access the Internet, enter your credentials here.

section.title: Secure store
section.para: Define or reset the master password used to protect login credentials as well as access keys for machine translation services.
Before resetting the master password, always make a backup of that information, because it will be deleted and will have to be re-entered.

section.title: Plugins
section.para: Displays the list of all the installed plugins.
Plugins are installed either in the folder under the , or in the platform-specific .
Additional plugins can be found on the OmegaT development site.

section.title: Updates
section.para: Use this option to choose whether to be automatically notified of updates to OmegaT.
If OmegaT detects an update, it will display a link to the download page. See for details.
